ygData.subject: Re: Faction Standing
ygData.msgSnippet: One way I know of, not that this is the only way is to consider the target of a faction.  For instance if you target someone and it says they look at you
ygData.messageBody:
One way I know of, not that this is the only way is to consider the target
of a faction. For instance if you target someone and it says they look at
you amiably, then your standing with that particular faction is good. If
they look at you dubiosly then well.. it's not so sure.

Syrel Feyn

-----Original Message-----
From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
To: 'eqpaladin@onelist.com' <eqpaladin@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, April 30, 1999 9:42 AM
Subject: [eqpaladin] Re: Faction Standing


>From: Rodney Miller <RMiller@...>
>
>Last night, another paladin, a warrior and myself were camping in the east
>commonlands near one of the orc Centurion camps. We killed a large number
>of the evil beasts and were rewarded with a great number of Deathfist
Belts.
>However, another side effect is that whenever I personally finished off an
>orc, my standing would get better with the Knights of Truth and the common
>peoples and such. How can you tell what your standing with the guild is?
I
>went back to the Hall of Truth and considered everybody and talked to a
>number of the npc's at the Hall of Truth. I also checked the prices they
>offered me for my goods and the prices of the items they had. I couldn't
>detect any changes. How can you tell if your standing has gotten better?
>And how many times do you have to kill orcs to bring about a change?
>
>Grod
>11th Level Paladin
>Innoruuk Server
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
